subject: Ethics
title: The Sweatshop Labor Debate
description: A quick win: understand The Sweatshop Labor Debate.

hook.text: A child in Vietnam stitches Nike shoes for 20 cents an hour. An economist says this is 'better than the alternative.'

buildup.text: Sweatshops pay extremely low wages in poor conditions. Millions of workers in developing countries depend on them.

discovery.text: Critics demand boycotts and shutdowns. But some economists argue sweatshop jobs beat subsistence farming or starvation.

twist.text: That 'least bad option' argument ignores a third choice: paying workers fairly while still earning profit.

climax.text: The real question isn't sweatshops vs nothing. It's why companies earning billions can't pay a living wage.

punchline.text: Cheap for consumers. Cheap for workers. Expensive for conscience.

quiz.question: What does the sweatshop debate often overlook?
options: That sweatshop workers enjoy their conditions
The possibility of paying fair wages while still remaining profitable
That no alternatives to sweatshop labor exist
